result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Demarrius Shadon Crossley

records.addlTxt:
2:33 PM Defendant Demarrius Shadon Crossley in court.  Prosecuting attorney Kristian Kanekoa Lindo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant contacted Public Defender's Office, Public Defender's Office requesting paperwork regarding car payment to determine if he will qualify for representation or not. Bail to continue.
Arraignment scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant called at 12:04 pm, he is travelling from Illinois and ran into delays,  his current ETA is 12:45 pm.  He will be late for the 1:15 pm hearing.  Sent email to Clerk DK .
22R 009930  Bond posted at Sheriff's Dept on 9/23/2022.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: No contact with: B.P. or N.S.S. No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container. No possession of drug paraphernalia. Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.

12:59 PM Defendant Demarrius Shadon Crossley appeared by video, in custody at Ozaukee County Jail.  Attorney Heather Dvoran in court as a friend of the court for Demarrius Shadon Crossley. Prosecuting attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading. Defendant will be retaining counsel. Court reviews charges/penalties and advises Defendant on right to an Attorney. State requesting $5000 cash bail with conditions.
Arraignment scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
